name: Maori People of New Zealand Online Trivia | Mixed Nations | 5 Questions

questions.text: The Maori people are the indigenous people of New Zealand. What does the name 'Maori' literally mean?
questions.explanation:
normal.

	Maori is also the name of the native language.

questions.text: What is the name of the Maori peoples' mythical homeland?
questions.explanation:
Hawaiiki.

	Hawaiiki probably refers to a number of different Polynesian islands from which the Maori people likely originated.

questions.text: The seven major 'iwi' or tribes of Maori people are each symbolized by a 'waka'. What is a waka?
questions.explanation:
canoe.

	Most Pacific islander cultures consider the canoe to be a very important cultural item.  After all, this is how the cultures spread from island to island!

questions.text: Who was the first European to enter New Zealand waters and to observe the Maori?
New Zealand was officially annexed under a treaty signed in 1840. What was the treaty called?
questions.explanation:
Treaty of Waitangi.

	This treaty was signed by less than 40 percent of Maori chiefs even though the treaty stipulated that all Maori chiefs give up their chieftainship. This resulted in numerous wars and uprisings.
